comment: This is a mixed bag - although users are allowed to use their content as they choose, they also are required through participation to allow Urban Dictionary to sell and use their content as they choose.

According to the copyright and ownership page, the participants retain the definitions as their "sole and exclusive property" but they must also "grant the Company an irrevocable, perpetual, worldwide, royalty-free, fully sublicenseable, non-exclusive license to copy, distribute, sell, publicly display..."
Participants retain the rights to their definitions, but also grant the FSE universal rights to them.
